comment:
* Describes the requested power state of the display.
     *
     * This object is intended to describe the general characteristics of the
     * power state, such as whether the screen should be on or off and the current
     * brightness controls leaving the DisplayPowerController to manage the
     * details of how the transitions between states should occur.  The goal is for
     * the PowerManagerService to focus on the global power state and not
     * have to micro-manage screen off animations, auto-brightness and other effects.

variables.name: POLICY_OFF
variables.comment: including playing a screen off animation if applicable.

variables.name: POLICY_DOZE
variables.comment: Policy: Enable dozing and always-on display functionality.

variables.name: POLICY_BRIGHT
variables.comment: Policy: Make the screen bright as usual.

variables.name: policy
variables.comment: The basic overall policy to apply: off, doze, dim or bright.

variables.name: useProximitySensor
variables.comment: nearby, turning it off temporarily until the object is moved away.

variables.name: screenBrightnessOverride
variables.comment: Set to PowerManager.BRIGHTNESS_INVALID if there's no override.

variables.name: screenAutoBrightnessAdjustmentOverride
variables.comment: 1 (brighter). Set to Float.NaN if there's no override.

variables.name: boostScreenBrightness
variables.comment: If true, applies a brightness boost.

variables.name: dozeScreenState
variables.comment: Overrides the policy for adjusting screen brightness and state while dozing.

methods.name: private boolean floatEquals(float f1, float f2)

methodNames: private boolean floatEquals(float f1, float f2)
